These entities represent measurable properties or values related to the absorption behavior of a material. Absorption peak wavelengths refer to the specific wavelengths at which a material absorbs electromagnetic radiation most strongly. Absorption edge wavelengths mark the point where a material begins to absorb significantly in a given spectral region. The optical band gap is the energy required to promote an electron from the valence band to the conduction band in a material.
